data.name: Marine Radar Simulator - VR
data.detailed_description:
Become a skipper on your own boat.

Choose day, night or fog along the way. Operate Steering wheel, Throttles,
Radar, Maps and Autopilot as you would have done on board a real boat.

In Screen mode, you use the mouse and keyboard, and you can switch between watching large versions of Radar, Map and Visual, or seeing everyone on the screen at the same time.

If you select VR mode, you can also use a gamepad to maneuver and operate the instruments mentioned above.

If you only want to be a passenger on the bridge, start a trip that sails a ready-made route automatically (selected in the start-up dialog).

You will find a comprehensive and detailed user manual on our website -> https://www.enavsim.com
data.about_the_game:
Become a skipper on your own boat.

Choose day, night or fog along the way. Operate Steering wheel, Throttles,
Radar, Maps and Autopilot as you would have done on board a real boat.

In Screen mode, you use the mouse and keyboard, and you can switch between watching large versions of Radar, Map and Visual, or seeing everyone on the screen at the same time.

If you select VR mode, you can also use a gamepad to maneuver and operate the instruments mentioned above.

If you only want to be a passenger on the bridge, start a trip that sails a ready-made route automatically (selected in the start-up dialog).

You will find a comprehensive and detailed user manual on our website -> https://www.enavsim.com
data.short_description: The simulator can be used in both Screen mode and VR mode. In VR mode, you can maneuver the boat and operate the radar and the map with a gamepad. In both modes you can choose to be a passenger on the bridge while the autopilot steers the boat, or be the skipper yourself.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 7 or newer (64 bits)
  • Processor: Intel, AMD - Quad core 3 GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Monitor-> NVIDIA 660 / VR -> NVIDIA 980
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: We use OpenXR in VR
